page.title: 11Entertainment
page.content: The Halfway House is a public house owned by Donnington's Brewery and tenanted by Mr. and Mrs. D. Marshall who have been there since 1979. They serve real beers, lager and wines and spirits. They also serve a lot of food and the Pub is very popular particular in the summer when people travel from the nearby towns for an evening in the country. There is a darts team,an occasional cricket team and annual visits from a Morris Dancing team and a jazz band. It is called the Halfway House because it is about halfway between the Plough Inn at Ford and the Farmer's Arms at Guiting Power.
